newsitem.title: ISRAEL: RESEARCH ALERT-Electric Fuel EPS cut.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Electric Fuel EPS cut.

text.p: Lehman Brothers increased its 1997 loss per share estimate for Electric Fuel and said it expects the Israeli company to report a further loss in 1998.

"We have increased our EPS loss estimate for 1997 to $0.51 from $0.13. We also expect losses in 1998, though reduced from the 1997 level, as production from the Deutsche Post programme is not likely to start until late 1998," Lehman analyst Joseph Phillippi said in a report.
Lehman estimated the company would lose $0.32 a share in 1998. Last year it lost $0.81.

"Near term results are not a key part of the company's long term story. Potential orders from Deutsche Post, Deutsche Telekom and Vattenfall still remain the key factors in our model," the report said.
Electric Fuel is a start-up developing a zinc-air battery for commercial light vehicles. It is engaged in a comprehensive field test with the German postal system.
